definition: the old man moves mountains (idiom); fig. where there's a will, there's a way
to be stupid/to cheat or deceive/me or I (modest)

public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
to move/to shift/to change/to alter/to remove
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable
surname Shan

sentences.english: It sounds like a modern version of "Yugong Removing the Mountains".
sentences.chinese: 這簡直就是現代版的愚公移山啊。

sentences.english: Legend has it that this is where the Follish Old Man removed the mountains.
sentences.chinese: 據傳說，這就是當年愚公移山的地方。

sentences.english: There is a belief, called Jingwei.
sentences.chinese: 有一種執着，叫愚公移山。

sentences.english: Yugong Yishan is a Beijing classic.
sentences.chinese: 愚公移山是北京最爲經典的場地。

sentences.english: Mt. Yugongyi is in a fable famous story.
sentences.chinese: 愚公移山是傳說中的一個著名故事。

sentences.english: He does things as consistently as Yugong's moving away the mountains.
sentences.chinese: 他這個人幹事很有愚公移山的精神。

sentences.english: Jam Session of Yugong Yishan's very own big band.
sentences.chinese: 愚公移山大樂隊的歡樂會議。

definition: lit. mythical bird Jingwei tries to fill the ocean with stones (idiom); futile ambition/task of Sisyphus/determination in the face of impossible odds
to grind an iron bar down to a fine needle (idiom); fig. to persevere in a difficult task/to study diligently
see 磨杵成針|磨杵成针[mo2 chu3 cheng2 zhen1]
dripping water penetrates the stone (idiom); constant perseverance yields success/You can achieve your aim if you try hard without giving up./Persistent effort overcomes any difficulty.
man can conquer nature (idiom); human wisdom can prevail over nature
dripping water penetrates the stone (idiom); constant perseverance yields success/You can achieve your aim if you try hard without giving up./Persistent effort overcomes any difficulty.
a really determined person will find a solution (idiom); where there's a will, there's a way
pinyin: you3 zhi4 zhe3 shi4 jing4 cheng2

definition: dripping water penetrates the stone (idiom); constant perseverance yields success/You can achieve your aim if you try hard without giving up./Persistent effort overcomes any difficulty.
lit. to pierce the wall to steal a light (idiom)/fig. to study diligently in the face of hardship
to abandon one's body in the search for Buddha's truth (idiom)
to start practicing at the first crow of the cock (idiom)/to be diligent in one's studies
for the common good and forgetting personal interests (idiom); to behave altruistically/selfless
lit. until you reach the Great Wall, you're not a proper person; fig. to get over difficulties before reaching the goal
pinyin: bu4 dao4 Chang2 cheng2 fei1 hao3 han4

definition: to study assiduously and tirelessly (idiom)/see also 頭懸梁，錐刺股|头悬梁，锥刺股[tou2 xuan2 liang2 , zhui1 ci4 gu3]
see 百折不撓|百折不挠[bai3 zhe2 bu4 nao2]
heroine of Qin dynasty 秦朝 folk tale, who searched for her husband, and whose tears broke down a stretch of the Great Wall to reveal his body
